intro: Saurauia sarapiquensis, commonly known as the Sarapiquí winterbark, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Central America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and has small, leathery leaves that help it retain moisture. Its unique botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in tropical montane ecosystems.
